name: PHP CS Fixer
description: Automatically format PHP files on save using php-cs-fixer with HTML support.

children.title: PHP path
children.description: path to your PHP installation, leave empty to use the default OS PHP installation.

children.title: PHP CS Fixer path
children.description: path to your fixer executable, if empty the fixer included with the extension will be used.

children.title: Format on save
children.description: Enable to automatically format on file save

children.title: Ignore remote files
children.description: Ignore format on save for remote files

children.title: Fixer Dedicated server Port
children.description: If using a dedicated server to fix the files, you can adjust the server port here.

children.title: PHP dedicated server
children.description: Starting PHP can be a little slow, having a small server will speed up formatting

children.title: Show logs
children.description: Only for debug and in case the extenstion does not work correctly

children.title: Fixer Rules
children.description: Define the rules you want to apply, please read the docs for more information.

children.title: Global config path
children.description: Instead of defining rules you can use a global .php_cs file for all the projects, if you add a .php_cs in the root of your project it will be used instead of the global configuration. The rules above will be ignored if the configuration file is used.

children.title: Format HTML in PHP files
children.description: Enable this box to try to fix HTML in PHP files

children.title: Apply Additional fixes
children.description: Enable this box to apply aditional fixes to HTML/PHP files

children.title: HTML Rules
children.description: Define the rules you want to apply when formatting HTML. (one per line)
